Welcome to Protection in python’s documentation!¶

class Protection.distance.ABB_REO517_settings(r1, r2, r3, x1, x2, x3, a, g, dx=0, dy=0)¶

Settings for Siprotec 7ST63x Values are given and saved as primary values :param - r1: :type - r1: Resistance reach of first zone :param - r2: :type - r2: Resistance reach of second zone :param - r3: :type - r3: Resistance reach of third zone :param - x1: :type - x1: Reactance reach of first zone :param - x2: :type - x2: Reactance reach of second zone :param - x3: :type - x3: Reactance reach of third zone :param - a1: :type - a1: Alpha reach of first zone (first quadrant) :param - a2: :type - a2: Alpha reach of second zone (first quadrant) :param - a3: :type - a3: Alpha reach of third zone (first quadrant) :param - g1: :type - g1: Gamma reach of first zone (4. quadrant, defined positive) :param - g2: :type - g2: Gamma reach of second zone (4. quadrant, defined positive) :param - g3: :type - g3: Gamma reach of third zone (4. quadrant, defined positive)

class Protection.distance.impedanceDiagram(name)¶

Class for impedance Diagram

Example:

import Protection.distance as prot a = prot.impedanceDiagram(“U1”) a.test()

draw_ending()¶

Finishing up the drawing by adding legends, etx

draw_first_section()¶

Function for drawing sections towards next stations. r,x,name at end

draw_infeed(r1, x1, path)¶

Function for drawing the infeed curve

Formula:

Z_seen_from_relay = U^2 / ((U^2/Z) - P_infeed) U: lowest accepted voltage Z: impedance of section P_infeed: infeed power from train or branch.

draw_load_at_beginning()¶

Function for drawing load at beginning of section Draws points at 7 intervall between 0 and maximum phi. If 60 degree, one pr 10 degree.

Method:

Rp = |U|^2 / (S_load*cos(phi)) Xp = |U|^2 / (S_load*sin(phi)) q = Rp/Xp Rs = Rp/(q^2+1) Xs = Rs*q

Typical values S = 10 MVA U = 10 kV phi = 0 - 60 deg

draw_load_at_end(r1, x1)¶

Function for drawing load at end of section Draws points at 7 intervall between 0 and maximum phi. If 60 degree, one pr 10 degree.

Method:

Rp = |U|^2 / (S_load*cos(phi)) Xp = |U|^2 / (S_load*sin(phi)) q = Rp/Xp Rs = Rp/(q^2+1) + section_resistance Xs = Rs*q + sectioin_reactance

Typical values S = 10 MVA U = 10 kV phi = 0 - 60 deg

draw_second_section()¶

Functioin for drawing sections behind the next station r,x,name_at_start, name_at_end

draw_setup()¶

figure, ax, xlim, ylim …

find_highest_reactance_of_infeed(r1, x1)¶

Function for finding the highest reactance based on infeed

Formula:

Z_seen_from_relay = U^2 / ((U^2/Z) - P_infeed) U: lowest accepted voltage Z: impedance of section P_infeed: infeed power from train or branch.

class Protection.distance.siprotec_7ST63x_settings(z1, z2, z3, r1=5.0, r2=5.0, r3=5.0, a1=30, a2=30, a3=30, b1=135, b2=135, b3=135, g1=15, g2=15, g3=15, dx=0, dy=0)¶

Settings for Siprotec 7ST63x Values are given and saved as primary values :param - z1: :type - z1: Impedance reach of first zone :param - z2: :type - z2: Impedance reach of second zone :param - z3: :type - z3: Impedance reach of third zone :param - r1: :type - r1: Resistance reach of first zone :param - r2: :type - r2: Resistance reach of second zone :param - r3: :type - r3: Resistance reach of third zone :param - a1: :type - a1: Alpha reach of first zone (first quadrant) :param - a2: :type - a2: Alpha reach of second zone (first quadrant) :param - a3: :type - a3: Alpha reach of third zone (first quadrant) :param - b1: :type - b1: Beta reach of first zone (2. quadrant) :param - b2: :type - b2: Beta reach of second zone (2. quadrant) :param - b3: :type - b3: Beta reach of third zone (2. quadrant) :param - g1: :type - g1: Gamma reach of first zone (4. quadrant, defined positive) :param - g2: :type - g2: Gamma reach of second zone (4. quadrant, defined positive) :param - g3: :type - g3: Gamma reach of third zone (4. quadrant, defined positive)

change_CT_ratio(CT_prim, CT_sek)¶

Function for changing the current transformer ratio. Default: 800/5 A

change_VT_ratio(VT_prim, VT_sek)¶

Function for changing the voltage transformer ratio. Default: 16000/110 V

draw_all(ax)¶

Draws the diagram in the order: Z3, Z2, Z1, grid lines

draw_zone1(ax)¶

Code for drawing Zone 1 Parameter ——— ax : matplotlib.axes where the drawing is to be added

draw_zone2(ax)¶

Code for drawing Zone 2 Parameter ——— ax : matplotlib.axes where the drawing is to be added

draw_zone3(ax)¶

Code for drawing Zone 3 Parameter ——— ax : matplotlib.axes where the drawing is to be added

scale_ax(ax)¶

Function for scaling the diagram according to zone 3 Parameter ——— ax : matplotlib.axes where the drawings are to be added

to_secondary_values()¶

Print impedances in secondary values Primary Z = U / I

Secondary current I’ = I * CT_secondary/CT_primary Secondary voltage U’ = U * VT_secondary/VT_primary

Secondary Z’ = U’ / I’ = U * VT_secondary/VT_primary / (I * CT_secondary/CT_primary)

Z’ = Z * (VT_secondary/VT_primary)/(CT_secondary/CT_primary)
